citation.title: Precision measurement of the Newtonian gravitational constant

files_downloaded.description: Table 3 from the paper: Measurements of G after 2000
files_downloaded.contains: 13 individual G measurements from 2000-2018 with lab IDs, methods, values, and ppm uncertainties

data_quality_notes: Peer-reviewed compilation from National Science Review (Oxford Academic)
Contains the two HUST-18 measurements from Li et al. Nature 2018 (12 ppm each)
UWash-00 (Gundlach & Merkowitz) is the 14 ppm gold-standard measurement
All uncertainties are 1-sigma as reported in original publications

units.uncertainty: ppm (parts per million) relative standard uncertainty

relevant_for_M3_check.note: M3 coupling epsilon = alpha^2 ~ 53 ppm. The most precise measurements (HUST-18 at 12 ppm, UWash-00 at 14 ppm) have sensitivity below this scale, while the scatter between experiments (~300-500 ppm) is well above it.
